00023 class DrawingArea(tkinter.Canvas):
00024     """Enhanced Canvas widget for CAD drawings."""
00025     def __init__(self, master, resources):
00026         tkinter.Canvas.__init__(self, master)
00027 
00028         self.master=master
00029         self.focus_force()
00030 
00031         self.__XMLfile = resources
00032         self.psize=self.__pointSz()       # compute once/stay the same for the whole session
00033 
00034         self["background"] = "black"
00035         self.defaultFg = "white"
00036 
00037         self.scale_f2i=[0.1, 10]                                      # 100 mm at 10 pixels - should be moved to xml configuration file
00038         self.translatedFactor = [tkinter.IntVar(), tkinter.IntVar()]  # only for integer representation of pixels; [h, w]
00039         self.zoomedFactor = 1.1                                       # zoom 10 %
00040 
00041         self.translatedFactor[0].set(0)
00042         self.translatedFactor[1].set(0)
00043 
00044         self.currentPos=[tkinter.IntVar(), tkinter.IntVar()]
00045         self.currentDir=[tkinter.IntVar(), tkinter.IntVar()]
00046 
00047         self.csys={}
00048 
00049         # add data like self.points["label"]={"floatinfo":fkernel.point(**options),
00050         #                                     "intPosition":[x, y],
00051         #                                     "graphRepr":{}}
00052         self.points={}
00053         self.segments={}
00054         self.arcs={} # begin with a single type of an arc.
00055 
00056         self.faces={}
00057 
00058         # bindings
00059         self.bind("<Button-3>", self.__startRec)
00060         self.bind("<Motion>", self.__updateCurrentPos, add="+")
00061         self.bind_all("<Motion><ButtonRelease-3>", self.translate, add="+")
00062         self.master.bind("<MouseWheel>", self.zoom, add="+") # zoom MSWindows
00063         self.master.bind("<Button-4>", self.zoom, add="+")   # zoom Linux
00064         self.master.bind("<Button-5>", self.zoom, add="+")   # zoom Linux
00065 
00066     def __pointSz(self, size=0.5):
00067         """Computes the size as being size % of the root window max(width, height)."""
00068         a = max(int(size/100.0*float(self.master.winfo_screenwidth())),
00069                 int(size/100.0*float(self.master.winfo_screenheight()))) # always rounding towards zero
00070         if not a%2: a=a/2
00071         else: a=(a+1)/2
00072 
00073         return a
00074 
00075     def translate(self, event):
00076         self.move("translate", event.x-self.currentDir[0].get(), event.y-self.currentDir[1].get())
00077         # update the canvas integer coordinates of all the involved entities:
00078 
00079         # self.csys
00080         for i in list(self.csys.keys()):
00081             self.csys[i]["intPosition"][0]+=event.x-self.currentDir[0].get()
00082             self.csys[i]["intPosition"][1]+=event.y-self.currentDir[1].get()
00083         # self.points
00084         for i in list(self.points.keys()):
00085             self.points[i]["intPosition"][0]+=event.x-self.currentDir[0].get()
00086             self.points[i]["intPosition"][1]+=event.y-self.currentDir[1].get()
00087 
00088     def zoom(self, event): # scroll wheel zoom
00089         if event.num == 4: # scrolled up
00090             lfactor = self.zoomedFactor
00091         if event.num == 5: # scrolled down
00092             lfactor = 1.0/self.zoomedFactor
00093 
00094         # MSWindows
00095         if event.delta == 120: # scrolled up
00096             lfactor = self.zoomedFactor
00097         if event.delta == -120: # scrolled down
00098             lfactor = 1.0/self.zoomedFactor
00099 
00100         self.scale_f2i[1] *= lfactor
00101 
00102         # zoom csys
00103 
00104         for i in list(self.csys.keys()):
00105             # new
00106 
00107             xNew = lfactor*self.csys[i]["intPosition"][0]+self.currentPos[0].get()*(1-lfactor)
00108             yNew = lfactor*self.csys[i]["intPosition"][1]+self.currentPos[1].get()*(1-lfactor)
00109 
00110             self.move(i, xNew-self.csys[i]["intPosition"][0], yNew-self.csys[i]["intPosition"][1])
00111 
00112             self.csys[i]["intPosition"][0]=xNew
00113             self.csys[i]["intPosition"][1]=yNew
00114 
00115         # zoom points
00116         for i in list(self.points.keys()):
00117             # new
00118 
00119             xNew = lfactor*self.points[i]["intPosition"][0]+self.currentPos[0].get()*(1-lfactor)
00120             yNew = lfactor*self.points[i]["intPosition"][1]+self.currentPos[1].get()*(1-lfactor)
00121 
00122             self.move(i, xNew-self.points[i]["intPosition"][0], yNew-self.points[i]["intPosition"][1])
00123 
00124             self.points[i]["intPosition"][0]=xNew
00125             self.points[i]["intPosition"][1]=yNew
00126 
00127         # zoom lines
00128 
00129     def dispCsys(self, intPos, length=12, rotation=0, visible=1):  # length option [%] should be moved to xml canvas settings file
00130         """Graphically creates and display a coordinate system"""
00131 
00132         if visible == 1:
00133             state=tkinter.NORMAL
00134         else:
00135             state=tkinter.HIDDEN
00136 
00137         return [self.create_line(intPos[0], intPos[1], intPos[0]+int(length*self.psize*math.cos(rotation/180.0*3.14159)), intPos[1]-int(length*self.psize*math.sin(rotation/180.0*3.14159)), arrow=tkinter.LAST, fill=self.defaultFg, state=state),
00138                 self.create_line(intPos[0], intPos[1], intPos[0]-int(length*self.psize*math.sin(rotation/180.0*3.14159)), intPos[1]-int(length*self.psize*math.cos(rotation/180.0*3.14159)), arrow=tkinter.LAST, fill=self.defaultFg, state=state)] # 0x axis, Oy axis
00139 
00140     def dispPoint(self, intPos, representation, color, visible=1, filled=0):
00141         """Graphically creates and display on canvas a point entity"""
00142 
00143         if visible == 1:
00144             state=tkinter.NORMAL
00145         else:
00146             state=tkinter.HIDDEN
00147 
00148         if color == "default":
00149             color=self.defaultFg
00150 
00151         if filled ==1:
00152             fill=color
00153         else:
00154             fill=self["background"]
00155 
00156         if representation == "square": # to add possibility for active fill
00157             idPoint=self.create_rectangle(intPos[0]-self.psize, intPos[1]-self.psize,
00158                                           intPos[0]+self.psize, intPos[1]+self.psize,
00159                                           outline=color, fill=fill, state=state)
00160         if representation == "circle":
00161             idPoint=self.create_oval(intPos[0]-self.psize, intPos[1]-self.psize,
00162                                      intPos[0]+self.psize, intPos[1]+self.psize,
00163                                      outline=color, fill=fill, state=state)
00164         if representation == "triangle":
00165             idPoint=self.create_polygon(intPos[0], intPos[1]-int(2*self.psize*1.73/3.0),
00166                                         intPos[0]-self.psize, intPos[1]+int(2*self.psize*1.73/6.0),
00167                                         intPos[0]+self.psize, intPos[1]+int(2*self.psize*1.73/6.0),
00168                                         outline=color, fill=fill, state=state)
00169 
00170         return idPoint
00171 
00172     def setGlobalCsys(self): # length option [%] should be moved to xml canvas settings file
00173         """Creates the global coordinate system. """
00174 
00175         if "global" not in list(self.csys.keys()):
00176             self.csys["global"]={}
00177             self.csys["global"]["intPosition"]=[self.winfo_width()/2+self.translatedFactor[0].get(),
00178                                                 self.winfo_height()/2+self.translatedFactor[1].get()]
00179 
00180             self.csys["global"]["floatinfo"]=fkernel.csys([0.0, 0.0])
00181 
00182             # graphical stuff
00183             self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]={}
00184             self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["visible"]=1 # to modify this setting in order to be loaded from canvas xml settings file
00185             self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["entities"]=self.dispCsys([self.csys["global"]["intPosition"][0], self.csys["global"]["intPosition"][1]], rotation=0.0)
00186 
00187             self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["tags"]=["global", "csys", "translate"]
00188 
00189             for i in self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["tags"]:
00190                 self.addtag_withtag(i, self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["entities"][0])
00191                 self.addtag_withtag(i, self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["entities"][1])
00192 
00193             # register the global coordinate system into the XML tree
00194             # like so <CSys id="global" parent="none" type="cartesian">0.0 0.0 0.0</CSys>
00195             g_csys=self.master.xmlprojfiles["geometry"][0].createElement("Csys")
00196             g_csys.setAttribute('id', 'global')
00197             g_csys.setAttribute('parent', 'none')
00198             g_csys.setAttribute('type', 'cartesian')
00199             g_csys.appendChild(self.master.xmlprojfiles["geometry"][0].createTextNode("0.0 0.0 0.0"))
00200             self.master.xmlprojfiles["geometry"][2][0].appendChild(g_csys)
00201 
00202     def float2int(self, csys_ints, reals, type_):
00203         """Transforms float coordinates into canvas coordinates."""
00204         # for now with no respect to the translation & zooming
00205         # but it can deal with polar coordinate systems
00206 
00207         if type_ == "polar": # determine the canvas local (with respect to csys_ints) coordinates in cartesian
00208             localv = reals[0]*math.cos(reals[1]/180.0*3.14159), reals[0]*math.sin(reals[1]/180.0*3.14159)
00209         else:
00210             localv = reals[0], reals[1]
00211         return [csys_ints[0]+int(localv[0]*self.scale_f2i[1]/self.scale_f2i[0]),
00212                 csys_ints[1]-int(localv[1]*self.scale_f2i[1]/self.scale_f2i[0])]
00213 
00214     def __updateCurrentPos(self, event):
00215         """updates the self.CurrentPos attribute with the current cursor position"""
00216         self.currentPos[0].set(event.x)
00217         self.currentPos[1].set(event.y)
00218 
00219     def __startRec(self, event):
00220         """records the event.x, event.y if the right click is pressed"""
00221         self.currentDir[0].set(event.x)
00222         self.currentDir[1].set(event.y)
